title: Mike Hopkins’ Impromptu Space Gardening - The Unconventional Gardener

last_post.content:
In 2013, NASA astronaut Mike Hopkins did a little bit of DIY space gardening on the International Space Station.

He sprouted sunflower and pumpkin seeds in Ziplock bags and modified tubes.

Mike tweeted a handful of images of his gardening efforts, and I've collected them in a blog post (removing as much of the Twitter taint as possible 😂 ).

#SpacePlants #SpaceGardening

title: COVID-19 Trends and Insights

last_post.content: I am exploring what you can get out of the new NZ Ministry of Health dashboard, https://minhealthnz2.shinyapps.io/covid19/ , and there is pretty clear evidence of a sustained drop in the case fatality rate among 80 years and up in September. No particularly dramatic variant changes, and from the suddenness of the drop it does look more like the kind of response I would expect from better treatments rather than booster vaccines.

title: pnas.org/doi/10.1073/pnas.1913...

last_post.content:
This is a really interesting study. When Black newborns are cared for by Black physicians, their "clinical penalty" that is the difference in mortality from white newborns is halved.

What's fascinating, if you dive in, is that this is despite the fact that Black physicians tend to have higher caseloads, and also tend to serve more underresourced patients.

Things that make you go hmmmmm...

https://www.pnas.org/doi/10.1073/pnas.1913405117

HT: @TheRaDR

title: https://mstdn.link

last_post.content:
Ok, so.

Tweets look really good when you send them in Messages on iOS/macOS. Mastodon posts… don’t. So I built a little tool that makes them much nicer to look at:

https://mstdn.link

Add ?to={any Mastodon post URL} to the end of that domain and when you send it to a friend, you get the nice looking preview. Of course the page makes it easy to paste a URL in. And there’s a Shortcut to make it even easier on iOS or macOS.

title: 1.2-Million-Year-Old Obsidian Axe Factory Found In Ethiopia

last_post.content:
1.2 *million* year old workshop for making cutting tools (hand axes) from obsidian found in Ethiopia. Until now it has been the consensus that making tools from obsidian was rare until the comparatively recent Middle Stone Age (mesolithic).

This was long before modern humans (homo sapiens) emerged, so this was a trained process by one of our ancestor hominins.
#archaeology #paleontology
https://www.iflscience.com/1-2-million-year-old-obsidian-axe-factory-found-in-ethiopia-67232

Research papers increasingly refer to websites like GitHub for code, which may be a problem...

About 20% of preprints referred to GitHub in 2021. Yet, these web pages are often not archived, jeopardizing their long-term availability.

"The growing use of Git Hosting Platforms in scholarly publications points to an urgent and growing need for dedicated efforts to archive their holdings in order to preserve research code"

via https://doi.org/10.48550/arXiv.2208.04895

title: Meredith Whittaker (@Mer__edith@mastodon.world)

last_post.content:
You should read @Mer__edith's thread on all this,¹ and it's worth remembering what @signalapp does and does not do.

Signal does not protect you from:
• an untrustworthy chat partner
• a compromised device
• corporate device management
• your device's Operating System

Signal does protect you from:
• a hack of the Signal servers
• a subpoena of the Signal servers
• the wire between you and the Signal servers
• the employees at Signal

¹ https://mastodon.world/@Mer__edith/109751701529562752

title: Exclusive: Treasury helped Putin ally sue UK journalist

last_post.content:
If you're tuning in to this story from outside the U.K. you won't believe it, but it's true.

Yevgeny Prighozin is head of Russian mercenary group Wagner. He's been sanctioned in the U.K since 2019.

The U.K. government overrode their own sanctions to allow Prighozin to pursue a libel case against a U.K. journalist in a U.K. court using a U.K. law firm.

And what was the libel case about?
The journalist said Prigozhin was the head of Russian mercenary group Wagner...

https://www.opendemocracy.net/en/prigozhin-government-russia-ukraine-hack-libel-slapp/

Experian says the weakness persisted on their site for 47 days, from Nov. 9, 2022 until three days after I notified them.
